image.altText: A watch, ring, bracelet, police tape.

props.synopsis: Police allege the men travelled to Australia to rob a Canberra home, stealing distinctive, luxury items.

title.children: 'Like a movie': French men came to Canberra for a $10m heist, police say

image.altText: A man in a yellow puffer jacket, walking with his hands in his pockets and his head down.

props.synopsis: A judge says the former art shop worker had a "complete disconnect between perception and reality" as she jails him for rape.

title.children: Man jailed for 'orchestrated' rape of customer in shop where he worked

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff dressed in court robes walks down a street. in Brisbane

props.synopsis: The man who led the inquiry into the criminal prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann loses his appeal to have serious corruption findings against him overturned.

title.children: Walter Sofronoff loses appeal against corruption finding

image.altText: Card Catalogue

props.synopsis: The NLA has more than 10 million items, but they are all in storage. Now a new exhibition reveals a selection of its hidden treasures.

title.children: It's one of the country's biggest libraries, so where are all the books?

image.altText: The exterior of Bed Bath N' Table, which has beds and other homewares inside. It's within a mall.

props.synopsis: The stoush began in 2021 when the company House began opening new stores selling soft furnishings under the name House, Bed & Bath.

title.children: Retailer Bed Bath N' Table wins High Court case against competitor

image.altText: A man faces the camera in a mughsot, with long dark braids and wearing a blue t-shirt.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man has been sentenced to six years in jail after a string of high-speed police chases, including at extreme speeds on the wrong side of the road.

title.children: Canberra man jailed over series of high-speed chases

image.altText: Amy Lane sad

props.synopsis: Patients have described the procedure as "life changing" but pelvic botox injections are no longer available publicly in the ACT, with Canberra Health Services ceasing the procedure "as a precaution due to unknown risks".

title.children: Canberra doctor ordered to stop botox injections for endometriosis pain

image.altText: A pixelated background with various video game characters leaping in the air.

props.synopsis: The biggest night in gaming is getting underway in the heart of downtown Los Angeles. Follow along in our live blog.

title.children: Australian game Hollow Knight: Silksong wins first trophy at Game Awards 2025

image.altText: close up of Bulgarian Prime Minister Rosen Zhelyazkov

props.synopsis: Bulgaria's prime minister announced the decision in a televised address saying "ahead of today's vote of no confidence, the government is resigning".

title.children: Bulgaria faces turmoil after anti-corruption protests topple government

image.altText: The exterior of an ANZ Bank branch.

props.synopsis: Former ANZ chief executive Shayne Elliott is suing the bank for stripping him of $13.5 million in bonuses. Local stocks are rallying after the Dow hit new records in a mixed session for Wall Street overnight. Follow live.

title.children: Former ANZ boss sues bank over $13.5 million in lost bonuses

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ex-ANZ CEO wants 'earliest possible hearing' of case
Tomago Aluminium set to remain open

image.altText: A hospital bed is pushed down a corridor towards the camera.

props.synopsis: State health ministers had their final meeting of the year with their federal counterpart on Friday armed with figures showing a 25 per cent increase in just three months of aged care patients stranded in hospitals.

title.children: 'Furious' states attack feds over aged care patients in hospitals

image.altText: A close up side shot of Mark Butler looking serious.

props.synopsis: States and territories have rejected a public hospital funding offer from the federal government.

title.children: States and territories reject Commonwealth public hospital funding offer — as it happened

image.altText: A US military helicopter appearing blue in a video screenshot with an abseil line hanging out a side-door over a boat

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's assertions on foreign policy since his return to the White House have literally stretched from one end of the Western Hemisphere to the other.

title.children: Trump's oil tanker seizure raises questions about potential Venezuela blockade

image.altText: anthony albanese

props.synopsis: Parents will thank the government for giving them more agency in dealing with the social media issue but kids aren't voters and it is hard to see the issue deciding votes either way.

title.children: Albanese's social media ban is bold, but it will take years to judge its success

image.altText: Jim Chalmers walks down a hallway wearing a suit and red tie.

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers said there will be "strict conditions" on the South Korean defence conglomerate's stake in the strategic shipbuilder, in a nod to the diplomatic and security sensitivities surrounding the bid.

title.children: Treasurer approves Hanwha's double stake in Australian shipbuilder

image.altText: Dozens of police officers, protesters, and media on the steps of the convention centre surrounded by pepper spray.

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court judge awards $54,000 in damages to a protester who sued Victoria Police after officers used pepper spray at a protest in 2019 outside the Melbourne Exhibition Centre.

title.children: 'Cruel and degrading': Protester wins pepper-spray case against police

image.altText: A man wearing a grey suit jacket and white shirt looks on with a serious expression, as he holds his chin

props.synopsis: Carl Erik Rinsch is convicted on charges that he scammed Netflix out of $US11 million for a show that never materialised, instead using the cash for purchases including luxury cars and homewares.

title.children: Hollywood director convicted of scamming $16.5m from Netflix

image.altText: A orange tent on sand with meteors in the background.

props.synopsis: You'll need to get up early, but the views could be worth it to catch the best glimpse of the Geminids meteor shower this weekend.

title.children: How to see Australia's best meteor shower this weekend

image.altText: A side shot of a man with dark hair speaking into news microphones as he walks away from the courthouse.

props.synopsis: Celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright was earlier this year found guilty on two counts of attempting to pervert the course of justice. Today, the court will consider his sentence.

title.children: Matt Wright could be sentenced today — here's everything you need to know

image.altText: A tomago aluminium sign outside the smelter.

props.synopsis: A deal is being finalised between Tomago Aluminium and the state and federal governments to keep the smelter open beyond 2028.

title.children: Long-term power deal being finalised to keep aluminium smelter open

image.altText: A massive wave bursts into the air.

props.synopsis: A natural phenomenon leaves surfers in awe of the "earthquake" wave.

title.children: 'Magic wave' found off WA coast after surfer's decade-long search

image.altText: Sketch of man in green shirt sitting at table, orange background

props.synopsis: A former Sydney out-of-school-hours care worker has pleaded guilty to producing and possessing child abuse material and committing sexual acts against children while filming.

title.children: Former out-of-school-hours care worker pleads guilty to child abuse offences

image.altText: A man dressed in black with sunglasses on is walking

props.synopsis: Suspended NSW police officer Tylar Shepheard, charged with possessing child abuse material among other charges, has had strict conditions placed on him.

title.children: NSW police officer faces court over child abuse material charges

image.altText: A group of tech CEOs sit on a metal construction beam, a throwback to a famous photograph of workers on a skyscraper.

props.synopsis: The magazine cites the tremendous technological advances made by the artificial intelligence industry over the past year in bringing on the age of "thinking machines".

title.children: TIME magazine names 'The Architects of AI' as Person of the Year

image.altText: Screenshots of advertisements on Chinese social media promoting illegal immigration to Australia

props.synopsis: Recent boat arrivals in Western Australia offer a glimpse into how routes through South-East Asia, particularly Indonesia, are being used to reach Australia.

title.children: As US borders tighten, Australia becomes the new target for desperate Chinese migrants

image.altText: A designed image showing the Eagle Farm arch, horses racing on the track, apartment buildings and the BRC logo.

props.synopsis: Members of Queensland's richest horse racing club are demanding answers after they discovered its former chairman struck a lucrative deal with the developer of its luxury residential precinct while he had oversight of the $850 million project.

title.children: Backlash against Queensland's richest race club over former chair's income

image.altText: Profile of a man,

props.synopsis: Prosecutors in Greg Lynn's Victorian High Country murder trial are preparing for a second trial after the Court of Appeal quashed his conviction.

title.children: Greg Lynn successfully appealed his murder conviction. What happens now?

image.altText: unidentified teenage girl talking to a doctor

props.synopsis: Hospital managers and executives in NSW will be barred from blocking abortions because of moral and religious views, according to a document obtained by the ABC.

title.children: NSW hospital execs could be barred from blocking abortions on religious grounds

image.altText: Nemo stands on  stage after winning the trophy in 2024

props.synopsis: Swiss singer Nemo says they will return the trophy they won in 2024 over the EBU's decision to let Israel participate in 2026.

title.children: 2024 Eurovision winner returns trophy over Israel's participation

image.altText: Dicky Bill sign with photo of the family that runs the business

props.synopsis: Administrators for failed Australian salad farm company Dicky Bill reveal its business debts to hundreds of staff and suppliers could exceed $10 million.

title.children: Dicky Bill salad farm's $10m debt shock as creditors try to claw back millions

image.altText: Hands holding a purple-cover report held close to the body

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has committed more than $600 million over a decade to reduce the prevalence of — and protect the victims of — domestic, family and sexual violence, in response to a landmark royal commission earlier this year.

title.children: SA domestic violence royal commission prompts $674 million response

image.altText: Ashley Griffith was photographed sitting with a child in his lap while employed at a daycare centre.

props.synopsis: Ashley Paul Griffith was sentenced to life in prison last year for sexually abusing 69 girls at childcare centres in Brisbane and Italy over a two-decade period.

title.children: Review leaves parents to grapple with failings that enabled paedophile

image.altText: A composite Andrew David and Maurice Hawell in suits outside court

props.synopsis: Maurice Hawell and Andrew David, both 31, had been convicted of multiple counts of aggravated sexual assault and aggravated sexual touching in company, following a joint trial in the District Court last year.

title.children: Judge grants bail for Sydney men after pack-rape convictions quashed

image.altText: A man and a boy on a boat.

props.synopsis: Students and teachers of St Helens District High School defy the Stieglitz bushfire to rescue formal wear, assemble decorations and food and hold their year 10 formal.

title.children: Bushfire not enough to stop Tasmanian students from getting to their formal
